column1: Acton was born in Lewistown, Montana.
Acton was the senior staff scientist with the Space Sciences Laboratory, Lockheed Palo Alto Research Laboratory, California.
At mission conclusion, Acton had traveled over 2.8 million miles in 126 Earth orbits, logging over 190 hours in space.
Acton is married and has two children.
In 2006 he ran in elections to be the state representative of Montana's District 69, as a Democratic candidate.
In the event he lost to the Republican incumbent, Jack M. Wells of Belgrade.

column2: The group is actively involved in day-to-day operation and scientific utilization of the Japan/US/UK Yohkoh mission for studies of high-energy solar physics.
